file_content.text: My lord. Is it true? Did you really hand control of the cult over to the Veil?
Lying dog. Teach me to ever trust a Sith. They all lie through their teeth.
It was time I started building powerful allegiances. You have been loyal, but you are weak.
Change was needed.
I'm sure the Veil will find a place for you in the cult.
I'm sorry.
You can't get away with this. Lying scum.
Destris, calm down. You'll only make it worse.
My lord, please go. Before Destris does something rash.
Don't question me.
Enough. [Kill Destris.]
My lord! Please....
You can accept that the Veil is your new leader, or you can die like him.
Be careful what you say next.
I'm sorry.
He was a fool. Get over him.
Quit blubbering.
Y--yes, my lord. Of course. Please go.
My lord! How did the meeting with the Veil go?
The Veil was three people, but I made them see reason.
It was a success.
Three people? Who would've thought.
I got what I wanted, no thanks to you.
Well enough.
It could've been better, but I have the chip.
Bloody.
Sorry we couldn't be more help. I'm just amazed you got a meeting in the first place.
Stick around as long as you like. The members are happy to have you here.
My lord? Thank you again. I was wondering, I mean, what was between us....
I was merely indulging your admiration.
It was a fling.
I suppose I could linger a while if that's what you want.
Are you asking me to stay?
Well, um, yes. I mean, the place has gotten a lot nicer since you were last here....
Oxygen, nitrogen, carbon dioxide. A whole lot of nothing.
Just air.
Yes, my lord. Of course. Sorry I asked.
Stay as long as you like, my lord. We are always happy to have you among us.
My lord! You've returned to us!
My lord! The Great Healer!
My lord! The Great Dragon!
We'll tell Masters Rylee and Destris you're here.
We hope you'll be proud of the work we've done.
Yes, my lord, we practically own the streets.
My lord! Good to see you again.
Hope you like what we've done with the place. What can old Rylee and Destris do for you?
I understand you've been busy since I saw you last. I'm interested in the CN-12.
I need a sensor chip.
I'm trying to build a superweapon, and I require your aid. I need a chip called the CN-12.
I have a project in mind.
I'm here to reap the rewards of having my own cult. I need a chip called the CN-12.
I'm collecting donations.
CN-12, huh? Funny you should mention it.
We wanted to build your cult up into something big, see, and we picked the CN-12 to do it.
It's a real crazy technology, and it just happens some of the members worked on an early prototype called the Death Mark.
We saw an opening, and there you have it.
It was all dandy until a mucker called the Veil got involved. He's blasted our supply chain to pieces, and he controls the CN-12 market now.
Surely he'll be open to negotiations.
I need to talk to him.
He hasn't listened to a word so far.
No one interferes with my cult.
He's dead.
Well, maybe you can teach him a lesson. We're sore out of luck.
Were you just going to let him steal your business?
Why haven't you stopped him?
You know me, I don't take these things lying down.
He's not easy to get at. Holes up in Shadow Town.
And he made it clear he only wants to meet with the boss. We, uh, didn't think that was really an option.
I will put on my most unsettling display of charm.
Then I'll meet with him.
For the leader of this cult, I certainly am kept in the dark on a lot of things.
Next time, call.
I'm sorry, my lord. We won't let it happen again.
And here you had me thinking the Veil was smart. He'll die either way.
How stupid of him.
That's what I like about you, my lord. When you get an idea, you don't mess around.
Good luck.
